name: Julien
bio:
Pragmatic programmer, functional enthusiast, interested in building helpful abstractions, slightly obsessed with their composability and testability.

I've worked in different fields, but somehow always ended up handling huge amounts of sensor data. Currently doing so at [Sqooba.io](https://sqooba.io).

And to be totally open: I largely prefer spaces over tabs, but if you disagree I'd still be happy to see you at my talk :)

talks.title: Everything is a time-series. Where are the corresponding abstractions? How to (almost) hide away a heterogeneous reality.
talks.abstract:
Sensor data, system metrics, user events:  manipulating and using this data is our daily bread and butter.

But where are the abstractions that allow us to reason purely in terms of time-series, even if they are flaky, irregularly sampled and misaligned?

We present a tiny library that may help.
